abstract: A type that specifies a format for the year in a date format style.

codeExamples.code:
let meetingDate = Date() // Feb 9, 2021 at 3:00 PM
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.defaultDigits)) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.twoDigits)) // 21
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.extended(minimumLength: 5))) // 02021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.extended())) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.padded(6))) // 002021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.relatedGregorian())) // 2021

overview:
## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] type includes static factory variables and methods that create custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] objects:

To customize the year format in a string representation of a `Date`, use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/year(_:)]. The following example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] formats applied to a date.

If no format is specified as a parameter, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Day/defaultDigits] static variable is the default format.

For more information about formatting dates, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle].

# Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Year

**Structure**

A type that specifies a format for the year in a date format style.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Year
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] type includes static factory variables and methods that create custom [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] objects:



To customize the year format in a string representation of a `Date`, use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/year(_:)]. The following example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] formats applied to a date.

```swift
let meetingDate = Date() // Feb 9, 2021 at 3:00 PM
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.defaultDigits)) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.twoDigits)) // 21
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.extended(minimumLength: 5))) // 02021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.extended())) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.padded(6))) // 002021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.relatedGregorian())) // 2021
```

If no format is specified as a parameter, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Day/defaultDigits] static variable is the default format.

For more information about formatting dates, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle].

## Modifying a Year

- **defaultDigits**: The custom year format style showing the minimum number of digits that represents the numeric year.
- **twoDigits**: The custom format style portraying the two-digit numeric year, zero-padded if necessary.
- **padded(_:)**: Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of the calendar system of the provided length, zero-padded if necessary.
- **relatedGregorian(minimumLength:)**: Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of a non-Gregorian calendar system in the corresponding Gregorian year.
- **extended(minimumLength:)**: Returns a custom format style that portrays the year of the calendar system, encompassing all supra-year fields.

## Comparing Years

- **==(_:_:)**: Returns true if the two `Date` values represent the same point in time.

## Type Properties

- **omitted**: The option for not including the symbol in the formatted output.

## Modifying Date Style Format Symbols

- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.CyclicYear**: A type that specifies a format for a cyclic year in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Day**: A type that specifies the format for a day in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.DayOfYear**: A type that specifies the format for the day of the year in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.DayPeriod**: A type that specifies a format for the time period in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Era**: A type that specifies a format for the era in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Hour**: A type that specifies a format for the hour in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Minute**: A type that specifies the format for the minutes in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Month**: A type that specifies a format for the month in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Quarter**: A type that specifies the format for the quarter in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Second**: A type that specifies the format for the seconds in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.SecondFraction**: A type that specifies the format for the second fraction in a date format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.StandaloneMonth**: A type that specifies the format for a standalone month.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.StandaloneQuarter**: A type that specifies the format for a standalone quarter.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.StandaloneWeekday**: A type that specifies the format for a standalone weekday.
- **Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.TimeZone**: A type that specifies a format for the time zone in a date format style.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
